skillTree.localised_description: Those who follow the Changeling find themselves particularly mutable. One moment they are themselves, the next they are another. When enough have passed, they can never find themselves again.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.localised_description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Passive ability: "Arcane Conduit"

skillTree.localised_description: The moments that evoke the highest emotions are those that occur when the mask slips and falls.

effects.description: Attribute: Causes Terror

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: The disguise can be as exact as needed. Sometimes that need includes a striking set of tentacles!

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 (while transformed)
Weapon strength: +10% (while transformed)
Melee defence: +5 (while transformed)

skillTree.localised_description: Logistics, training and all those other nonsensical concepts don't apply when you can simply appear fully-formed with bow in hand.

effects.description: Ammunition: +25% (while transformed)
Reload time reduction: +25% (while transformed)

skillTree.localised_description: "You know, I'm something of a Wizard myself..."

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% to all spells
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: And when the curtain falls, the victim is left stupefied as the Changeling pulls back to savour his spoils.

effects.description: Access the assumed form's battle abilities when using "Formless Horror"
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +50%
Campaign movement range: +10% after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: Take from each guise a little sliver of what makes them special, and bring it to the fore.

effects.description: Armour: +25 (while transformed)
Charge bonus: +25% (while transformed)
Speed: +25% (while transformed)

skillTree.localised_description: "Would you really strike an old friend?"

effects.description: Physical resistance: 20% (while transformed)

skillTree.localised_description: "I put on my robe and Wizard guise…"

skillTree.localised_description: *mad cackling* "…Oh, yes… yes!"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

skillTree.localised_description: Unburdened by mass, Tzeentch's flaming servants surge toward the foe – the heralds of their utter doom, no less.

skillTree.localised_description: The thundering of their Chaos Steeds and chariots announces the arrival of Kaldour's dread Knights, and death is never far behind them.

skillTree.localised_description: For the Winged Watchers and Doomstriders of this world, their very lack of identifiable corporeal form shall be their armour against attack.

skillTree.localised_description: Even the bravest, most rational souls waver in the hideous, laughing face of their worst nightmares.

skillTree.localised_description: Of the many weapons available to Tchar, derangement must surely be the greatest and most satsifying to wield.

skillTree.localised_description: The flickering beings of flame are in many ways the purest servants of the Changer, for their gaseous forms are ever in a state of flux.

skillTree.localised_description: The best form of defence is attack, and the best form of attack is the one which reaches into the foe's mind and turns its contents against them.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.localised_description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

skillTree.localised_description: As they are a most adept and dedicated magic-user, where this one treads, the Winds always blow high and hard.

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.

skillTree.localised_description: It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of Change, though it may amount to nothing more than the cruellest of tricks, ensures the forces of Tzeeneth are fed and nourished.

skillTree.localised_description: The many faces of the Wind-lord are described here, along with all the terrible mysteries of destiny. Between these lines lurks insanity, ever waiting to trap the unwary.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit is Daemonic (has physical resistance, does not rout, is immune to terror, takes damage when Leadership is low)
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Trickster wanders wherever he decides, wearing the faces of his foes. He plants the seeds of Chaos in foreign lands, for wherever he goes, his cultists burrow deep.

effects.description: [HIDDEN] This faction does not attack settlements with its own foreign slots
Immune to diplomatic penalties from trespassing
Establish Trickster Cults instead of occupying territory
Can replenish and recruit in foreign territory
Armies are hidden in regions with Trickster Cult buildings

items.colour_text: Some say the Changeling’s stave is the source of his power. Wiser heads assume that is a lie and merely a prop of the Prankster’s manipulations. Perhaps it is both… or neither?
